US Government Economic Series Data from FRED API

usgov.append_fred_token(url, external=None)
usgov.fred_series(series, external=None, **query_params)

Returns series data from the US Federal Reserve and Economic Database (FRED) API.

Parameters

  • series (string, required) – The series ID of the data you want to return.

  • external (string, optional, default None) – If you want to use a token from outside your environment variables, use this param

  • file_type (string, optional) –

  • realtime_start (string, optional) –

  • realtime_end (string, optional) –

  • limit (string, optional) –

  • offset (string, optional) –

  • sort_order (string, optional) –

  • observation_start (string, optional) –

  • observation_end (string, optional) –

  • units (string, optional) –

  • frequency (string, optional) –

  • aggregation_method (string, optional) –

  • output_type (string, optional) –

  • vintage_dates (string, optional) –

Returns

Returns time series historical data for the requested FRED data

usgov.geofred_series_meta(series, external=None, **query_params)

Returns series meta data from the US Federal Reserve and Economic Database (FRED) API.

Parameters

  • series (string, required) – The series ID of the data you want to return.

  • external (string, optional, default None) – If you want to use a token from outside your environment variables, use this param

Returns

Returns meta data for the requested FRED data

usgov.geofred_regional_series(series, external=None, **query_params)

Returns geographically organized series data from the US Federal Reserve and Economic Database (FRED) API.

Parameters

  • series (string, required) – The series ID of the data you want to return.

  • external (string, optional, default None) – If you want to use a token from outside your environment variables, use this param

  • query_params (strings, key-value pairs, optional) – This function accepts any and all key-value pairs, but does not guarantee the validity of their use

Returns

Returns the historical, geographically organized time series data for the requested FRED data

usgov.get_yield()

A function that retrieves current Treasury Bond rates from the US Treasury website. :return: Dictionary containing all the T-Bond terms as keys (strings) and their rates as values (floats).
